list_definition.definition: a subatomic particle of light or other electromagnetic radiation that is used as a unit of electromagnetic energy

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: All light is made of photons.

list_ex_of_english: Charged particles will attain relativistic energies close to the pulsar magnetic poles and radiate -ray photons.
One detection scheme presently in use requires optical band-pass filters appropriately designed to bin emitted fluorescence photons of desired target molecules.
